meanings.definition: The ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions.
meanings.sent1: Her judgements in choosing the right path always led her to success.
meanings.sent2: I trust his judgements when it comes to important matters.
meanings.sent3: His judgements on which ice cream flavor to choose were always spot on.
meanings.sent4: Her judgements were like a compass guiding us through the stormy sea of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The judgements of the wise owl were sought by all the forest animals.

meanings.definition: An opinion or conclusion reached after careful consideration.
meanings.sent1: My judgements on the best movie to watch are always well thought out.
meanings.sent2: Her judgements about the new restaurant were positive.
meanings.sent3: His judgements on fashion trends were always a bit quirky.
meanings.sent4: Her judgements were like a puzzle with missing pieces, intriguing yet incomplete.
meanings.sent5: The judgements of the weatherman were proven wrong by the sudden rainstorm.

meanings.definition: The formal decision of a court on a matter submitted to it.
meanings.sent1: The judge's judgements in the courtroom were fair and just.
meanings.sent2: The jury's judgements were unanimous in the high-profile case.
meanings.sent3: The cat's judgements in the mock trial were quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The court's judgements echoed through the halls like thunder, final and resolute.
meanings.sent5: The judgements of the Supreme Court set a precedent for future cases.
